definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: Online demands abound that the railway minister, Sheng Guangzu, lose his job too.
sentences.chinese: 網絡熱呼鐵道部長盛光祖引咎辭職。

sentences.english: Because he was involved in the bribery, he acknowledged his mistake and resigned.
sentences.chinese: 因爲捲入賄賂案，他憤而引咎辭職。

sentences.english: President Fernando de la Rúa resigned.
sentences.chinese: 政府總統費爾南多德拉魯引咎辭職。

sentences.english: Sheng Minamata also revealed that Tokyo Electric Power president also intends to resign water.
sentences.chinese: 勝俁同時透露，東電社長清水也有意引咎辭職。

sentences.english: The resigned county head of environmental protection was identified as Chen Jun'an.
sentences.chinese: 縣環保局長陳軍安引咎辭職。

definition: to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
a tax declaration form/a tax return
